Final Year Projects at CIID

16 December 2013

Last week I had the pleasure of attending some of the final student presentations and end-of-year show at the Copenhagen Institute for Interaction Design. Here are some of my favourite projects:

I also really liked:

  • hej_verden - A toolkit to help children learn computer programming.
  • Little Treasures - A thoroughly-designed service designed to teach children about the concept of value and the use of money.
  • Hand Made - An exploration of human hand gestures, and a platform to collect novel hand gestures.

The work from CIID students was, as ever, thorough and thoughtful. It's a great programme.

Paul May is a researcher and designer from Dublin, living and working in London. See more of Paul's work or get in touch.
